official-title.#text:
Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives regarding
actions the President should take to secure the borders
of the United States.

sponsor.#tail: submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on

, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such
			 provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

text.#text: That it is the sense of the

Declare an end to the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program implemented pursuant to the
			 memorandum by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to keep apprehended
			 illegal immigrants in the custody of the

section 235(b)(3) of the William Wilberforce Trafficking Victims Protection

in the border region; and create an accelerated process to the maximum

personnel to cease enforcing
			 immigration laws except in certain narrowly proscribed circumstances, so
			 that the vast majority of illegal aliens would not be subject to
			 deportation;

text.#text:
Whereas on June 17, 2011, Immigration and Customs Enforcement Director John Morton issued a memo
			 directing

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
would no
			 longer be enforcing immigration laws against certain people who came to
			 this country as children, through the Deferred Action for Childhood
			 Arrivals (DACA) directive;

text.#text:
Whereas in fiscal year 2012, the number of minors from Central America began increasing, from over
			 10,000 in 2012, to over 20,000 in 2013, to 44,000 through June 30 of 2014;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: has stated that he is constrained by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
William Wilberforce Trafficking Victims Protection Reauthorization Act of
			 2008
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: William Wilberforce Trafficking Victims Protection Reauthorization Act of 2008

quote.#text:
That law already provides the administration with flexibility to accelerate the judicial process in
			 times of crisis. The administration should use that flexibility to speed
			 up the system while still treating these children humanely, with
			 compassion and respect.

text.#text: Whereas Senator Dianne Feinstein of California was quoted in the New York Times on July 7, 2014,

quote.#text: There’s leeway there that the executive branch of government doesn’t need new legislation.

text.#text: Whereas Senator Harry Reid of Nevada was quoted in the Washington Times on July 15, 2014, that

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: has the authority to deploy the

to secure the border from
			 illegal crossers under

and his Administration,
			 which led families to hire criminal smuggling organizations to bring their
			 children to enter the United States without authorization or visa, knowing
			 they would be allowed to remain and seek legal status; and

text.#text:
Whereas the influx of minors illegally crossing at the southwest border was created by policies and
			 statements of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: already possesses the tools to address this influx: Now, therefore, be it
